p: The ferric reducing antioxidant power (FRAP) assay was measured as described previously by Benzie and Strain [ 48], which determines the ability of the sample to reduce iron ferric (Fe 3+) to ferrous (Fe 2+). The determinations were carried out in a spectrophotometer Rayleigh UV-1601 (China) at 593 nm and concentration of FRAP was calculated from a linear equation obtained from a curve of vitamin C (purity 99%, Sigma-Aldrich) concentration vs absorbance. Different extract concentrations (ranging 25–40 μg/mL) were tested and equivalents μmol of vitamin C according to the standard curve of ascorbic acid (100, 200, 400, 800, 1000 μmol/L) were calculated. The experiment was carried out in triplicate and the results are expressed as vitamin C equivalents.
